data.name: Ampharos

abilities.name: Jamming
abilities.text: After your opponent plays a Supporter card from his or her hand, put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Pokémon. You can't use more than 1 Jamming Poké-Body each turn.

attacks.text: You may discard all Lightning Energy attached to Ampharos. If you do, this attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that has any Energy cards attached to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: The tip of its tail shines brightly. In the olden days, people sent signals using the tail's light.

abilities.name: Reactive Protection
abilities.text: Any damage done to Aerodactyl by attacks from your opponent's Pokémon is reduced by 10 for each React Energy card attached to Aerodactyl (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Power Blow
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to Aerodactyl.

attacks.name: Speed Stroke
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects, including damage, done to Aerodactyl by attacks from your opponent's Pokémon-ex.

data.name: Caterpie

attacks.name: Surprise Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: When attacked by bird Pokémon, it resists by releasing a terrifically strong odor from its antennae, but it often becomes their prey.

abilities.name: Froth
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you play Azumarill from your hand to evolve 1 of your Active Pokémon, you may use this power. Each Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Water Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each Water Energy attached to Azumarill. This attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage for each heads.

data.name: Celebi & Venusaur-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Pollen Hazard
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned, Confused, and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Evergreen-GX
attacks.text: Heal all damage from this Pokémon. If this Pokémon has at least 1 extra Grass Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), shuffle all cards from your discard pile into your deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

abilities.name: Dig Well
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may look at the top 3 cards of your deck, choose as many Water Energy cards as you like, and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. Discard the other cards. This power can't be used if Blastoise is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Aqua Press
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to all Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's).

attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy attached to Blastoise. Choose 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. This attack does 60 damage to each of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Blastoise can't use Double Launcher during your next turn.

attacks.name: Dragon Dance
attacks.text: During your next turn, if any of your current Active Pokémon does damage to any Defending Pokémon, this attack does 40 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Dragon Song
attacks.text: Each Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: As it grew taller and taller, it outgrew its reliance on psychic powers, while within it awakened the power of the sleeping dragon.

data.name: Kakuna
data.flavorText: While awaiting evolution, it hides from predators under leaves and in nooks of branches.

attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. If this Pokémon has at least 2 extra Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), heal all damage from all of your Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

attacks.name: Cell Storm
attacks.text: Discard 2 Psychic Energy attached to Deoxys and remove 6 damage counters from Deoxys.

data.flavorText: DNA from a space virus mutated and became a Pokémon. It appears where auroras are seen.

abilities.name: Fire Breath
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon. That Pokémon is now Burned. This power can't be used if Blaziken is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Clutch
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Fire Spin
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy attached to Blaziken.

data.name: Metapod
data.flavorText: Its shell is filled with a thick liquid. All of the cells throughout its body are being rebuilt in preparation for evolution.

data.name: Bellsprout
data.flavorText: Even though its body is extremely skinny, it is blindingly fast when catching its prey.

data.name: Team Aqua's Cacturne
rules: This Pokémon is both Grass Darkness type.

attacks.name: Dark Bind
attacks.text: You may discard a Darkness Energy card attached to Team Aqua's Cacturne. If you do, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Poison Barb
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Weedle

attacks.name: Triple Stab
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: It eats its weight in leaves every day. It fends off attackers with the needle on its head.

attacks.name: Bad News
attacks.text: If the number of cards in your opponent's hand is at least 6, choose a number of cards there, without looking, until your opponent has 5 cards left. Have your opponent discard the cards you chose.

attacks.name: Prize Count
attacks.text: If you have more Prize cards left than your opponent, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Giga Drain
attacks.text: Remove from Venusaur the number of damage counters equal to the damage you did to the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Arcanine
data.flavorText: This legendary Chinese Pokémon is considered magnificent. Many people are enchanted by its grand mane.

attacks.name: Phoenix Flame
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, shuffle Blaine's Moltres and all cards attached to it into your deck (after doing damage).

data.name: Aerodactyl

abilities.name: Prehistoric Power
abilities.text: No more Evolution cards can be played. This power stops working while Aerodactyl is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: A ferocious prehistoric Pokémon that goes for the enemy's throat with its serrated saw-like fangs.

data.name: Blastoise

abilities.name: Waterlog
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may attach as many basic Water Energy cards from your hand to any of your Pokémon in any way you like. If you do, your turn ends. This power can't be used if Blastoise is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Hydro Pump
attacks.text: Does 50 damage plus 20 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Blastoise but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 40 damage in this way.

data.flavorText: The jets of water it spouts from the rocket cannons on its shell can punch through thick steel.

data.name: Metapod

abilities.name: Adaptive Evolution
abilities.text: This Pokémon can evolve during your first turn or the turn you play it.

attacks.name: Harden
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, if this Pokémon would be damaged by an attack, prevent that attack's damage done to this Pokémon if that damage is 60 or less.

data.flavorText: A steel-hard shell protects its tender body. It quietly endures hardships while awaiting evolution.

data.name: Azumarill

attacks.name: Bubblebeam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: When it plays in water, it rolls up its elongated ears to prevent their insides from getting wet.

data.name: Ludicolo

abilities.name: Table Service
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may heal 30 damage from 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Punch and Run
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: If it hears festive music, all its muscles fill with energy. It can't help breaking out into a dance.

data.name: Dialga

attacks.name: Time Bellow
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Flash Cannon
attacks.text: You may return all Energy cards attached to Dialga to your hand. If you do, remove the highest Stage Evolution card from the Defending Pokémon and shuffle that card into your opponent's deck.

data.flavorText: It has the power to control time. It appears in Sinnoh-region myths as an ancient deity.

data.name: Oddish

attacks.name: Trip Over
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

data.flavorText: Its scientific name is "Oddium Wanderus." At night, it is said to walk nearly 1,000 feet on its two roots.

data.name: Dratini

attacks.name: Hypnotic Gaze
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: It is called the "Mirage Pokémon" because so few have seen it. Its shed skin has been found.

abilities.name: Gluey Slime
abilities.text: As long as Ariados is in play, each player must pay an additional Colorless to retreat his or her Active Pokémon. Gluey Slime can't make a player pay more than an additional Colorless to retreat a Pokémon, even if there is more than 1 Ariados in play.

attacks.name: Spider Force
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage. If tails, this attack does 20 damage and the defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Oddish

attacks.name: Sweet Scent
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from 1 of your Pokémon.

data.flavorText: During the day, it stays in the cold underground to avoid the sun. It grows by bathing in moonlight.

data.name: Pidgeot

attacks.name: Supersonic Flight
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon searches for food while flying at Mach 2. Its large claws make fearsome weapons.

data.name: Ditto

abilities.name: Transform
abilities.text: If Ditto is your Active Pokémon, treat it as if it were the same card as the Defending Pokémon, including type, Hit Points, Weakness, and so on, except Ditto can't evolve, always has this Pokémon Power, and you may treat any Energy attached to Ditto as Energy of any type. Ditto isn't a copy of any other Pokémon while Ditto is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: Capable of copying an enemy's genetic code to instantly transform itself into a duplicate of the enemy.

data.name: Clefable

attacks.name: Fairy Power
attacks.text: Return 1 of your Pokémon and all cards attached to it to your hand.

data.flavorText: With its acute hearing, it can pick up sounds from far away. It usually hides in quiet places.

attacks.name: Fairy Power
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, you may return any number of your Pokémon in play and all cards attached to them to your hand.

data.name: Dark Alakazam

attacks.name: Teleport Blast
attacks.text: You may switch Dark Alakazam with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Mind Shock
attacks.text: Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for this attack. (Any other effects that would happen after applying Weakness and Resistance still happen.)

data.flavorText: Almost as if it were being controlled by something else, it never changes expressions, even in the middle of battle.

data.name: Tangela

attacks.name: Flog
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: Many writhing vines cover it, so its true identity remains unknown. The blue vines grow its whole life long.

attacks.name: Smash Turn
attacks.text: After your attack, you may switch Blastoise with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Rocket Tackle
attacks.text: Blastoise does 10 damage to itself. Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Blastoise by attacks during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Blaziken

attacks.name: Fire Dance
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for a Fire Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Flame Kick
attacks.text: Discard 2 Fire Energy attached to Blaziken. This attack does 80 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: Flames spout from its wrists, enveloping its knuckles. Its punches scorch its foes.

data.name: Bulbasaur
data.flavorText: For some time after its birth, it grows by gaining nourishment from the seed on its back.

data.name: Turtwig
data.flavorText: Made from soil, the shell on its back hardens when it drinks water. It lives along lakes.

data.name: Celebi V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Find a Friend
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Pokémon, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Line Force
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Alakazam

abilities.name: Damage Swap
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move 1 damage counter from 1 of your Pokémon to another as long as you don't Knock Out that Pokémon. This power can't be used if Alakazam is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: Its brain can outperform a supercomputer. Its intelligence quotient is said to be 5000.

data.name: Garchomp

attacks.name: Dragon Rage
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If either of them is tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Jet Sword
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy attached to Garchomp and this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It flies at speeds equal to a jet fighter plane. It never allows its prey to escape.

data.name: Alolan Sandshrew

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: An ancient tradition of Alolan festivals, still carried on to this day, is a competition to slide Sandshrew across ice as far as one can.

data.name: Butterfree
data.flavorText: Its wings are covered in toxic scales. If it finds bird Pokémon going after Caterpie, Butterfree sprinkles its scales on them to drive them off.

data.name: Dragonite

abilities.name: Step In
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Dragonite is on your Bench, you may switch it with your Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: An extremely rarely seen marine Pokémon. Its intelligence is said to match that of humans.

data.name: Charmander

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: The flame on its tail indicates Charmander's life force. If it is healthy, the flame burns brightly.

abilities.name: Form Change
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for another Deoxys and switch it with Deoxys. (Any cards attached to Deoxys, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) If you do, put Deoxys on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward. You can't use more than 1 Form Change Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Crystal Laser
attacks.text: During your next turn, Deoxys's attacks do 40 more damage to the Defending Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

abilities.name: Reactive Shift
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may move a React Energy card attached to 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon. This power can't be used if Delcatty is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Energy Link
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for an Energy card and attach it to Delcatty.

attacks.name: Energy Shower
attacks.text: Attach any number of basic Energy cards from your hand to your Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Rainbow Burn
attacks.text: Does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each type of basic Energy card attached to Flygon.

data.name: Pineco
data.flavorText: It likes to make its shell thicker by adding layers of tree bark. The additional weight doesn't bother it.

data.name: Espeon δ
rules: This Pokémon is both Psychic Metal type.

abilities.name: Delta Heal
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may remove 1 damage counter from each of your Pokémon that has δ on its card. You can't use more than 1 Delta Heal Poké-Power each turn. This power can't be used if Espeon is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Psyshock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

abilities.name: Shapeshift
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may attach an Evolution card from your hand to Brock's Ninetales. (This doesn't count as evolving Brock's Ninetales.) Treat Brock's Ninetales as if it were that Pokémon instead. It can't evolve, devolve, or use the Pokémon Power of that Pokémon. During your turn, you may discard the Evolution card attached to Brock's Ninetales. This power can't be used if Brock's Ninetales is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed. If Brock's Ninetales becomes Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed, discard all Evolution cards attached to it.

attacks.name: Hyper Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard 1 Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Froslass

abilities.name: Snow Gift
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you play Froslass from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may search your deck for any 1 card and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Ground Frost
attacks.text: If there is any Stadium Card in play, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: It freezes prey by blowing its -58 degrees F breath. It is said to then secretly display its prey.

data.name: Metapod

attacks.name: Shed Skin
attacks.text: Heal 40 damage from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Its shell is filled with its soft innards. It doesn't move much because of the risk it might carelessly spill its innards out.

data.name: Lileep
rules: Put this card onto your Bench only with the effect of Root Fossil Lileep

abilities.name: Prehistoric Call
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is in your discard pile, you may put this Pokémon on the bottom of your deck.

attacks.name: Spiral Drain
attacks.text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It lived on the seafloor 100 million years ago and was reanimated scientifically.

data.name: Drapion

attacks.name: Toxic Fang
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 2 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokémon between turns.

data.flavorText: It attacks people and Pokémon that cross the desert. This has only furthered its bad reputation.

abilities.name: Form Change
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for another Deoxys and switch it with Deoxys. (Any cards attached to Deoxys, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) If you do, put Deoxys on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward. You can't use more than 1 Form Change Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Energy Loop
attacks.text: Return 2 Energy attached to Deoxys to your hand.

data.name: Hoppip

attacks.name: Flail Around
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: It drifts on winds. It is said that when Hoppip gather in fields and mountains, spring is on the way.

data.name: Skiploom
data.flavorText: It spreads its petals to absorb sunlight. It also floats in the air to get closer to the sun.

data.name: Mamoswine

attacks.name: Icy Wind
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Snowstorm
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that has any damage counters on it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: A frozen Mamoswine was dug from ice dating back 10,000 years. This Pokémon has been around a long, long, long time.

data.name: Yanmega

attacks.name: Supersonic
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: This six-legged Pokémon is easily capable of transporting an adult in flight. The wings on its tail help it stay balanced.

attacks.name: Dump and Draw
attacks.text: Discard up to 2 Energy cards from your hand. For each card you discarded, draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Electric Current
attacks.text: Move a Lightning Energy card attached to Electivire FB to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Kakuna

attacks.name: Shed Skin
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: While awaiting evolution, it hides from predators under leaves and in nooks of branches.

attacks.name: Growth
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, you may attach up to 2 Grass Energy cards from your hand to Erika's Venusaur.

attacks.name: Wide Solarbeam
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 2 of them (or 1 if he or she only has 1). This attack does 20 damage to each of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Thundershock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Pin Missile
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Charizard

abilities.name: Energy Burn
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may turn all Energy attached to Charizard into Fire Energy for the rest of the turn. This power can't be used if Charizard is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Fire Spin
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy cards attached to Charizard or this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: Spits fire that is hot enough to melt boulders. Known to unintentionally cause forest fires.

data.name: Kricketot

attacks.name: Double Headbutt
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 more damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: Its legs are short. Whenever it stumbles, its stiff antennae clack with a xylophone-like sound.

data.name: Magmortar

attacks.name: Hard Crush
attacks.text: Discard the top 3 cards from your deck. This attack does 50 damage times the number of Energy cards you discarded.

attacks.name: Mantle Bazooka
attacks.text: Discard 2 Fire Energy attached to Magmortar.

data.flavorText: It blasts fireballs of over 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit out of its arms. Its breath also sears and sizzles.

data.name: Weedle

attacks.name: Bug Hunch
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Grass Pokémon, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: Its poison stinger is very powerful. Its bright-colored body is intended to warn off its enemies.

attacks.name: Double Kick
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Turtwig

attacks.name: Nap
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: The shell on its back is made of soil. On a very healthy Turtwig, the shell should feel moist.

data.name: Dark Ampharos

abilities.name: Conductivity
abilities.text: Whenever your opponent attaches an Energy card from his or her hand to a Pokémon, this power does 10 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance.) This power stops working if you have more than 1 Dark Ampharos in play or while Dark Ampharos is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Shock Bolt
attacks.text: Discard all Lightning Energy cards attached to Dark Ampharos or this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: Its brightly lit tail can be seen for miles in the dark, even by ships on the sea.

data.name: Latias

attacks.name: Miraculous Light
attacks.text: Remove 2 damage counters and all Special Conditions from Latias.

attacks.name: Mist Ball
attacks.text: Discard a Fire and a Water Energy attached to Latias.

data.flavorText: Its body is covered with a down that can refract light in such a way that it becomes invisible.

data.name: Gyarados

attacks.name: Hyper Beam
attacks.text: Discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Once it appears, it goes on a rampage. It remains enraged until it demolishes everything around it.

data.name: M Venusaur-EX
rules: Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.
Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Crisis Vine
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed and Poisoned.

abilities.name: Hunch
abilities.text: As long as Beautifly's remaining HP is 40 or less, Beautifly does 40 more damage to the Defending Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Luring Antenna
attacks.text: Before doing damage, you may choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and switch it with 1 of the Defending Pokémon. If you do, this attack does 20 damage to the new Defending Pokémon. Your opponent chooses the Defending Pokémon to switch.

data.name: Chimchar

attacks.name: Ember
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard a Fire Energy attached to Chimchar.

data.flavorText: It agilely scales sheer cliffs to live atop craggy mountains. Its fire is put out when it sleeps.

data.name: Dialga

attacks.name: Time Rewind
attacks.text: Shuffle your hand into your deck.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon completely controls the flow of time. It uses its power to travel at will through the past and future.

data.name: Tangrowth

attacks.name: Bind Down
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Flog
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.flavorText: Even if one of its arms is eaten, it's fine. The Pokémon regenerates quickly and will go right back to normal.

abilities.name: Bubble Turn
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Azumarill is on your Bench, you may flip a coin. If heads, return Azumarill and all cards attached to it to your hand.

attacks.name: Aqua Sonic
attacks.text: Don't apply Resistance.

data.name: Dark Crobat

abilities.name: Surprise Bite
abilities.text: When you play Dark Crobat from your hand, you may choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This power does 20 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance.)

attacks.name: Dark Drain
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each of your opponent's Pokémon. For each heads, this attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance. Remove a number of damage counters from Dark Crobat equal to the damage dealt. If Dark Crobat has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

data.flavorText: Although the wings it has evolved on its feet allow it to fly at high speeds, they unfortunately make it difficult to perch.

data.name: Articuno

attacks.name: Freeze Dry
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Blizzard
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. If tails, this attack does 10 damage to each of your own Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: A legendary bird Pokémon that is said to appear to doomed people who are lost in icy mountains.

data.name: Onix

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon burrows through the earth at high speed, looking for food. The tunnels it digs are used by Diglett as nests.

data.name: Charizard

abilities.name: Energy Burn
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may turn all Energy attached to Charizard into Fire Energy for the rest of the turn. This power can't be used if Charizard is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Fire Spin
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy cards attached to Charizard in order to use this attack.

data.flavorText: Spits fire that is hot enough to melt boulders. Known to unintentionally cause forest fires.

data.name: Grotle

attacks.name: Knock Away
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: It knows where pure water wells up. It carries fellow Pokémon there on its back.

data.name: Vileplume

abilities.name: Irritating Pollen
abilities.text: Each player can't play any Item cards from his or her hand.

data.flavorText: It has the world's largest petals. With every step, the petals shake out heavy clouds of toxic pollen.

data.name: Charmander

attacks.name: Fire Fang
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

data.flavorText: From the time it is born, a flame burns at the tip of its tail. Its life would end if the flame were to go out.

data.name: Dark Electrode
rules: This Pokémon is both Lightning Darkness type.

abilities.name: Darkness Navigation
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Dark Electrode has no Energy attached to it, you may search your deck for a Darkness or Dark Metal Energy and attach it to Dark Electrode. Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used if Dark Electrode is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Energy Bomb
attacks.text: You may move all Energy cards attached to Dark Electrode to your Benched Pokémon in any way you like.

data.name: Roselia

attacks.name: Sweet Scent
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from 1 of your Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Its flowers give off a relaxing fragrance. The stronger its aroma, the healthier the Roselia is.

data.name: Tangela

attacks.name: Absorb
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It tangles any moving thing with its vines. Their subtle shaking is ticklish if you get ensnared.

data.name: Flareon δ
rules: This Pokémon is both Fire Metal type.

attacks.name: Delta Search
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Holon Energy card and attach it to Flareon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Return Burn
attacks.text: You may return an Energy card attached to Flareon to your hand. If you do, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

data.name: Gengar

abilities.name: Curse
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may move 1 damage counter from 1 of your opponent's Pokémon to another (even if it would Knock Out the other Pokémon). This power can't be used if Gengar is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Dark Mind
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and this attack does 10 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: Under a full moon, this Pokémon likes to mimic the shadows of people and laugh at their fright.

attacks.name: Reactive Poison
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 30 more damage for each Special Condition affecting the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Spider Trap
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep and Poisoned. Before applying this effect, you may switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with 1 of the Defending Pokémon. If you do, the new Defending Pokémon is now Asleep and Poisoned. Your opponent chooses the Defending Pokémon to switch.

data.name: Bellossom

attacks.name: Windmill
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Flower Tornado
attacks.text: Move as many Grass Energy attached to your Pokémon to your other Pokémon in any way you like.

data.flavorText: When the heavy rainfall season ends, it is drawn out by warm sunlight to dance in the open.

data.name: Dialga

abilities.name: Reverse Time
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you put Dialga from your hand onto your Bench, you may search your discard pile for up to 3 in any combination of Pokémon (excluding Pokémon LV.X) and basic Energy cards. Show them to your opponent and put them on top of your deck in any order.

attacks.name: Time-Space Traveling
attacks.text: Draw cards until you have 7 cards in your hand.

data.flavorText: It has the power to control time. It appears in Sinnoh-region myths as an ancient deity.

data.name: Electabuzz

attacks.name: Light Screen
attacks.text: Whenever an attack does damage to Electabuzz (after applying Weakness and Resistance) during your opponent's next turn, that attack only does half the damage to Electabuzz (rounded down to the nearest 10). (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage; if tails, this attack does 10 damage.

data.flavorText: A wild Pokémon with a short temper. It is able to distinguish colors, and likes the color red.

data.name: Jirachi

abilities.name: Stardust Song
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you put Jirachi from your hand onto your Bench, you may flip 3 coins. For each heads, search your discard pile for a Psychic Energy card and attach it to Jirachi.

attacks.name: Time Hollow
attacks.text: Choose a number of your opponent's Stage 1 or Stage 2 Evolved Pokémon up to the amount of Energy attached to Jirachi. Remove the highest Stage Evolution card from each of those Pokémon and put those cards back into your opponent's hand.

data.flavorText: Generations have believed that any wish written on a note on its head will come true when it awakens.

data.name: Pikachu

attacks.name: Growl
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon attacks Pikachu during your opponent's next turn, any damage done by the attack is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance). (Benching either Pokémon ends this effect.)

attacks.name: Thundershock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: When several of these Pokémon gather, their electricity could build and cause lightning storms.

attacks.name: Wrap
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Sonicboom
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

abilities.name: Fire Formation
abilities.text: Each of Charizard's attacks does 10 more damage for each Fire Pokémon on your Bench to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Burning Tail
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy attached to Charizard.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw 3 cards.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Mega Throw
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Pokémon-ex, this attack does 60 damage plus 40 more damage.

data.name: Pachirisu

attacks.name: Minor Errand-Running
attacks.text: Search your deck for a basic Energy card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Thunder Jolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Pachirisu does 10 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: It makes fur balls that crackle with static electricity. It stores them with berries in tree holes.

data.name: Team Aqua's Crawdaunt
rules: This Pokémon is both Water Darkness type.

attacks.name: Aqua Reverse
attacks.text: Before doing damage, you may choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that has Team Magma in its name and switch it with 1 of the Defending Pokémon. Your opponent chooses the Defending Pokémon to switch.

attacks.name: Deep Impact
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Venomoth

attacks.name: Dizzying Wind
attacks.text: Whenever your opponent plays a Trainer card from his or her hand during his or her next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that card has no effect. (Your opponent still discards that card.)

attacks.name: Noxious Scales
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused and Poisoned.

data.flavorText: The scales it scatters will paralyze anyone who touches them, making that person unable to stand.

abilities.name: Power Circulation
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your discard pile for up to 2 basic Energy cards, show them to your opponent, and put those cards on top of your deck in any order. If you do, put 2 damage counters on Delcatty. This power can't be used if Delcatty is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Power Heal
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Delcatty. Then, remove 2 damage counters from Delcatty.

data.name: Kakuna
data.flavorText: While awaiting evolution, it hides from predators under leaves and in nooks of branches.

data.name: Dark Arbok

attacks.name: Stare
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for this attack. (Any other effects that would happen after applying Weakness and Resistance still happen.) If that Pokémon has a Pokémon Power, that power stops working until the end of your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Poison Vapor
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: Freezes its prey with its stare. If you should encounter one, remember not to look into its eyes.

attacks.name: Aerowing
attacks.text: Before doing damage, you may flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. If heads, this attack does 60 damage instead.

data.name: Cresselia

attacks.name: Moon Twinkle
attacks.text: If there is any Stadium card in play, remove 2 damage counters from Cresselia.

attacks.name: Lunar Dance
attacks.text: You may discard 2 Energy attached to Cresselia. If you do, remove all damage counters from 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Shiny particles are released from its wings like a veil. It is said to represent the crescent moon.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Fire Spin
attacks.text: Discard 2 basic Energy cards attached to Flareon or this attack does nothing.

data.name: Manaphy

attacks.name: Dive
attacks.text: Look at the top 7 cards of your deck, choose 1 of them, and put it into your hand. Put the other cards back on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Water Glow
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Remove from Manaphy the number of damage counters equal to the damage you did to that Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It is born with a wondrous power that lets it bond with any kind of Pokémon.

data.name: Yanma

attacks.name: Super Speed
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: If it flaps its wings really fast, it can generate shock waves that will shatter windows in the area.

data.name: Venusaur

abilities.name: Floral Fragrance
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Poison Powder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: After a rainy day, the flower on its back smells stronger. The scent attracts other Pokémon.

abilities.name: Shadow Curse
abilities.text: If Gengar would be Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, you may put 3 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Cursed Reaction
attacks.text: Put 2 damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like. If Gengar has any React Energy cards attached to it, put 4 damage counters instead.

data.name: Heatran

attacks.name: Fire Fang
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Magma Mantle
attacks.text: Discard the top 3 cards of your deck. This attack does 60 damage plus 20 more damage for each Fire or Metal Energy card you discarded.

data.flavorText: Its body is made of rugged steel. However, it is partially melted in spots because of its own heat.

data.name: Cradily

attacks.name: Lifesplosion
attacks.text: For each Energy attached to this Pokémon, search your deck for a Stage 2 Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Spiral Drain
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It lives in the shallows of warm seas. When the tide goes out, it digs up prey from beaches.

abilities.name: Levitate
abilities.text: As long as Flygon has any Energy attached to it, the Retreat Cost for Flygon is 0.

attacks.name: Sand Pit
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

abilities.name: Heal Dance
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may remove 2 damage counter from 1 of your Pokémon. You can't use more than 1 Heal Dance Poké-Power each turn. This power can't be used if Gardevoir is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Mind Shock
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

data.name: Darkrai

attacks.name: Reach Over
attacks.text: Search your deck for an Energy card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Darkness Pursuit
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Cresselia, this attack's base damage is 100.

data.flavorText: It can lull people to sleep and make them dream. It is active during nights of the new moon.

abilities.name: Flower Supplement
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, attach 1 basic Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Benched Pokémon. This power can't be used if Bellossom is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Knife Leaf
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Fly
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. If heads, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Rayquaza during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Yanma

attacks.name: Air Slash
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Its eyes can see 360 degrees without moving its head. It won't miss prey—even those behind it.

data.name: Shuckle

attacks.name: Share
attacks.text: Heal 40 damage from 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Double Stab
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: The berries stored in its vaselike shell eventually become a thick, pulpy juice.

data.name: Latios

attacks.name: Energy Draw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a basic Energy card and attach it to Latios. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Luster Purge
attacks.text: Discard 3 Energy attached to Latios.

data.flavorText: A highly intelligent Pokémon. By folding back its wings in flight, it can overtake jet planes.

data.name: Venusaur-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Poison Powder
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Jungle Hammer
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Ampharos

attacks.name: Attract Current
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. For each heads, you may search your deck for a Lightning Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Lightning Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Gigavolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage. If tails, this attack does 40 damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: The bright light on its tail can be seen far away. It has been treasured since ancient times as a beacon.

data.name: Ivysaur

attacks.name: Sleep Powder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Poison Powder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: When the bud on its back starts swelling, a sweet aroma wafts to indicate the flower's coming bloom.

data.name: Weepinbell

attacks.name: Muddy Acid
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: The leafy parts act as cutters for slashing foes. It spits a fluid that dissolves everything.

data.name: Gloom

attacks.name: Foul Odor
attacks.text: Both this Pokémon and the Defending Pokémon are now Confused.

attacks.name: Poison Powder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: The honey it drools from its mouth smells so atrocious, it can curl noses more than a mile away.

data.name: Dragonair

attacks.name: Healing Melody
attacks.text: Heal 10 damage from each of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: If its body takes on an aura, the weather changes instantly. It is said to live in seas and lakes.

data.name: Dusknoir

abilities.name: Dark Palm
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if your opponent has 4 or more Benched Pokémon, you may choose 1 of them and shuffle that Pokémon and all cards attached to it into his or her deck. This power can't be used if Dusknoir if affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Hard Feelings
attacks.text: Put 5 damage counters on the Defending Pokémon. Then, count the number of Prize cards your opponent has taken and put that many damage counters on the Defending Pokémon.

data.flavorText: The antenna on its head captures radio waves from the world of spirits that command it to take people there.

data.name: Entei

abilities.name: Burning Coat
abilities.text: Whenever 1 of your opponent's Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from Entei's attacks, discard the top 3 cards from your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Blaze Roar
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Flip a coin. If tails, discard 2 Fire Energy attached to Entei.

data.flavorText: It is said that when it roars, a volcano erupts somewhere around the globe.

data.name: Hoppip
data.flavorText: It drifts on winds. It is said that when Hoppip gather in fields and mountains, spring is on the way.

data.name: Roselia

attacks.name: Absorb
attacks.text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Its flowers give off a relaxing fragrance. The stronger its aroma, the healthier the Roselia is.

data.name: Seedot

attacks.name: Trip Over
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

data.flavorText: When it dangles from a tree branch, it looks just like an acorn. It enjoys scaring other Pokémon.

data.name: Kakuna

abilities.name: Grass Cushion
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has any Grass Energy attached to it, it takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: Almost incapable of moving, this Pokémon can only harden its shell to protect itself when it is in danger.

abilities.name: Energy Connect
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move a basic Energy card attached to 1 of your Benched Pokémon to your Active Pokémon. This power can't be used if Ampharos is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Miraculous Thunder
attacks.text: You may discard all Lightning Energy attached to Ampharos. If you do, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned and Confused.

data.name: Togepi

attacks.name: Bawl
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon is still immature. When threatened, it releases poison from its head and tries to drive its enemies away.

data.name: Electivire

abilities.name: Intense Voltage
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), if Elekid is anywhere under Electivire, you may move a Lightning Energy attached to your Pokémon to Electivire. This power can't be used if Electivire is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Giga Impact
attacks.text: You may discard all Lightning Energy attached to Electivire. If you do, this attack's base damage is 120 instead of 60.

data.flavorText: It pushes the tips of its two tails against the foe, then lets loose with over 20,000 volts of power.

data.name: Gloom

attacks.name: Sleep Powder
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: Smells incredibly foul! However, around one out of a thousand people enjoy sniffing its nose-bending stink.

data.name: Hitmontop

attacks.name: Triple Kick
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Close Combat
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Hitmontop by attacks is increased by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: It launches kicks while spinning. If it spins at high speed, it may bore its way into the ground.

attacks.name: Rock Vengeance
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on all of your Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Rock Slide
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon (1 if there is only 1). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Team Aqua's Kyogre
rules: This Pokémon is both Water Darkness type.

abilities.name: Power Saver
abilities.text: As long as the number of Pokémon in play (both yours and your opponent's) that has Team Aqua in its name is 3 or less, Team Aqua's Kyogre can't attack.

attacks.name: Aqua Trip
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Aqua Smash
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is affected by a Special Condition, this attack does 50 damage plus 20 more damage.

data.name: Dragonite

attacks.name: Hyper Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hurricane Tail
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 60 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: It is said to make its home somewhere in the sea. It guides crews of shipwrecks to shore.

data.name: Flygon

abilities.name: Irritating Buzz
abilities.text: As long as Flygon is your Active Pokémon, put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Active Pokémon between turns, excluding Fighting Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sand Sonic
attacks.text: If you attach a Fighting Energy card from your hand to Flygon during this turn, this attack does 60 damage plus 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: It whips up sandstorms with powerful flaps of its wings. It is known as "The Desert Spirit."

data.name: Servine

attacks.name: Wrap
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: They avoid attacks by sinking into the shadows of thick foliage. They retaliate with masterful whipping techniques.

attacks.name: Leaf Poison
attacks.text: If Breloom has any Grass Energy attached to it, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Hustle Punch
attacks.text: During your next turn, Hustle Punch attack's base damage is 50 instead of 70.

data.name: Blissey

abilities.name: Softboiled
abilities.text: When you play Blissey from your hand, you may flip a coin. If heads, remove 8 damage counters from Blissey. If tails, remove 4 damage counters from Blissey. Either way, if Blissey has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: Anyone who takes even one bite of Blissey's egg becomes unfailingly caring and pleasant to everyone.

data.name: Dark Donphan

attacks.name: Tusk Toss
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, flip a coin. If heads, return the Defending Pokémon and all cards attached to it to your opponent's hand. If tails, your opponent chooses 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon and switches it with the Defending Pokémon.

data.flavorText: The larger its tusks, the higher its status in the herd.

data.name: Vileplume

abilities.name: Allergy Panic
abilities.text: Apply Weakness for each Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's) as ×4 instead.

attacks.name: Pollen Spray
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep and Poisoned.

data.flavorText: Its petals are the largest in the world. As it walks, it scatters extremely allergenic pollen.

data.name: Piplup

attacks.name: Water Splash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage.

data.flavorText: Because it is very proud, it hates accepting food from people. Its thick down guards it from cold.

data.name: Paras
data.flavorText: Whether it's due to a lack of moisture or a lack of nutrients, in Alola the mushrooms on Paras don't grow up quite right.

data.name: Seedot

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.flavorText: It attaches itself to a tree branch using the top of its head. Strong winds can sometimes make it fall.

data.name: Blastoise δ
rules: This Pokémon is both Fighting Metal type.

abilities.name: Shield Veil
abilities.text: Each of your Active Pokémon has no Weakness.

attacks.name: Enraged Linear Attack
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage for each damage counter on Blastoise to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Charizard

attacks.name: Wild Tackle
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 50 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: When expelling a blast of superhot fire, the red flame at the tip of its tail burns more intensely.

data.name: Dialga

abilities.name: Time Aura
abilities.text: As long as Dialga is your Active Pokémon, your opponent can't play any Pokémon from his or her hand to evolve his or her Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Metal Burn
attacks.text: Discard all Metal Energy attached to Dialga.

data.flavorText: It has the power to control time. It appears in Sinnoh-region myths as an ancient deity.

data.name: Pachirisu

attacks.name: Minor Errand-Running
attacks.text: Search your deck for a basic Energy card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Thunder Jolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Pachirisu does 10 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: It makes fur balls that crackle with static electricity. It stores them with berries in tree holes.

data.name: Tangrowth

attacks.name: Mega Drain
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Grass Knot
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each Colorless in your opponent's Active Pokémon's Retreat Cost.

data.flavorText: Its vines grow so profusely that, in the warm season, you can't even see its eyes.

data.name: Nuzleaf
data.flavorText: The sound of its grass flute makes its listeners uneasy. It lives deep in forests.

abilities.name: Delta Protection
abilities.text: Any damage done to Camerupt by attacks from your opponent's Pokémon that has δ on its card is reduced by 40 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Linear Attack
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Dark Blastoise

attacks.name: Hydrocannon
attacks.text: Does 30 damage plus 20 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Dark Blastoise but not used to pay for this attack. You can't add more than 40 damage in this way.

attacks.name: Rocket Tackle
attacks.text: Dark Blastoise does 10 damage to itself. Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Dark Blastoise during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

data.flavorText: An aggressive Pokémon that tackles anything it sees.

data.name: Dark Espeon

attacks.name: Gouge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage; if tails, this attack does 10 damage.

attacks.name: Psysplash
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon for each Energy card attached to that Pokémon. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance.

data.flavorText: The tips of its split tail quiver whenever it uses its psychic abilities to read its opponent's next move.

data.name: Nidoking

abilities.name: Pheromone Stamina
abilities.text: Nidoking gets +20 HP for each Nidoqueen you have in play.

attacks.name: Venomous Horn
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: Its tail is thick and powerful. If it binds an enemy, it can render the victim helpless quite easily.

data.name: Torterra

attacks.name: Guard Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Rumble Stomp
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 20 more damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: Some Pokémon are born on a Torterra's back and spend their entire life there.

data.name: Charizard

abilities.name: Resolute Flame
abilities.text: This Pokémon's attacks do 30 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon for each of their Pokémon-GX and Pokémon-EX in play.

attacks.name: Fiery Blast
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Its wings can carry this Pokémon close to an altitude of 4,600 feet. It blows out fire at very high temperatures.

data.name: Jumpluff

attacks.name: Fluffy Transport
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with his or her Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Solar Step
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage times the number of your remaining Prize cards.

data.flavorText: Even in the fiercest wind, it can control its fluff to make its way to any place in the world it wants.

data.name: Arcanine

abilities.name: Security Guard
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, all of your Pokémon take 30 less damage from your opponent's attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: Legends tell of its fighting alongside a general and conquering a whole country.

data.name: Kakuna

attacks.name: Hide
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: While awaiting evolution, it hides from predators under leaves and in nooks of branches.

attacks.name: Cheer Up
attacks.text: Draw a card. If you have Plusle in play, draw 2 cards instead.

attacks.name: Negative Ion
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done by attacks from the Defending Pokémon is reduced by 10 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Power Bolt
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon that has any Poké-Powers. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Kricketune

attacks.name: White Noise
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Draining Cut
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads. Heal from this Pokémon the same amount of damage you did to the Defending Pokémon.

data.flavorText: There is a village that hosts a contest based on the amazingly variable cries of this Pokémon.

data.name: Jumpluff

attacks.name: Mass Attack
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of Pokémon in play (both yours and your opponent's).

attacks.name: Leaf Guard
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Jumpluff by attacks is reduced by 30 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: Once it catches the wind, it deftly controls its cotton-puff spores—it can even float around the world.

data.name: Vileplume-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Fragrant Flower Garden
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may heal 30 damage from each of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Massive Bloom
attacks.text: This attack does 10 less damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Allergic Explosion-GX
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned, Paralyzed, and Poisoned. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Treecko

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

data.flavorText: Small hooks on the bottom of its feet catch on walls and ceilings. That is how it can hang from above.

data.name: Gastly

attacks.name: Ominous Eyes
attacks.text: Put 1 damage counter on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Should a strange light be seen flickering in an abandoned building, Gastly is lurking there.

attacks.name: Summon Storm
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If both of them are heads, this attack does 20 damage to each other Pokémon (even your own). Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for this attack.

attacks.name: Dragon Tornado
attacks.text: Unless this attack Knocks Out the Defending Pokémon, choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and switch it with the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Clefable

attacks.name: Metronome
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. Metronome copies that attack except for its Energy costs and anything else required in order to use that attack, such as discarding Energy cards. (No matter what type the Defending Pokémon is, Clefable's type is still Colorless.)

attacks.name: Minimize
attacks.text: All damage done by attacks to Clefable during your opponent's next turn is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: A timid Fairy Pokémon that is rarely seen. It will run and hide the moment it senses people.
